You can use this class to implement simple path-based overlay views or subclass it to define additional drawing behaviors. The default drawing behavior of this class is to apply the object’s current fill attributes, fill the path, apply the current stroke attributes, and then stroke the path.

# MKOverlayPathView

**Class**

Represents a generic overlay that draws its contents using a Core Graphics path data type.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class MKOverlayPathView
```

## Overview

You can use this class to implement simple path-based overlay views or subclass it to define additional drawing behaviors. The default drawing behavior of this class is to apply the object’s current fill attributes, fill the path, apply the current stroke attributes, and then stroke the path.

If you subclass, you should override the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKOverlayPathView/createPath] method and use that method to build the appropriate path for the overlay. You can invalidate this path as needed and force the path to be recreated using whatever new data your subclass has obtained.

In iOS 7 and later, use the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKOverlayPathRenderer] class to display path-based overlays instead.

## Classes

- **MKCircleView**: Provides the visual representation for an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKCircle] annotation object.
- **MKOverlayView**: Defines the basic behavior associated with all overlay views.
- **MKPolygonView**: Provides the visual representation for an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKPolygon] annotation object.
- **MKPolylineView**: Provides the visual representation for an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKPolyline] annotation object.
- **MKPinAnnotationView**: An annotation view that displays a pin image on the map.

## Inherits From

- MKOverlayView

## Inherited By

- MKCircleView
- MKPolygonView
- MKPolylineView

## Conforms To

- CALayerDelegate
- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSObjectProtocol

- UIFocusItem

- UIPasteConfigurationSupporting
